Question: What is your investment objective?
Ans1: To maximise returns, regardless of risk
Ans2: To make high returns, without excessive risk
Ans3: To make good returns, with limited risk to my capital
Ans4: To make returns which beat inflation, without significant risk to my capital

Question: How concerned would you be with a short-term (6 months) 10% decline in your investment?
If you invested €10,000 today, what range of potential values would you consider to be an acceptable return for your investment after 5 years?
Do you have other savings available to you, should you encounter a financial emergency?
Ans1: Yes, I have specific savings that I can use in an emergency
Ans2: I have a large amount of other savings, but nothing earmarked for a financial emergency
Ans3: I have a moderate amount of other savings, but nothing earmarked for a financial emergency
Ans4: I have a small amount of other savings, but nothing earmarked for a financial emergency
Ans5: No, I have no other savings I can use in the event of an emergency

Question: If you could increase the value of your investment by taking more risk, what would you do?
Ans1: Take a LOT more risk with ALL of your money
Ans2: Take a LITTLE more risk with ALL of your money
Ans3: Take a LITTLE more risk with SOME of your money
Ans4: Be UNWILLING to take any more risk
Ans5: REDUCE the risk of your investment
